summary: Highly motivated software developer with a passion for dev ops. Specializing in small to medium sized web apps and CMS integration. I strive to develop responsive web applications with my main focus being performance and accessibility. I enjoy learning and using the most current technologies to provide the best user experience while satisfying customer needs. I write clean, responsive code and always hit my deadlines. My most recent work includes an event management app for Angel City Sports that was built with Apollo Server, Prisma, Auth0, React, and PostgreSQL.

experience.description: I entered a 2 month paid internship for a company that specialized in front end development.

While building a full stack web application for Angel City Sports, I was hired by AdaptivApps as a full stack developer. My responsibilities ranged from database architecture to styling and animation for the client.

projects.name: Inland Northwest Tehnologists
projects.description: INT is a static project using Gatsby, NetlifyCMS, and Markdown as a data source. I was tasked with rebuilding a previously designed website using a new set of frameworks and technologies. This website is 100% responsive and has an outstanding Lighthouse score in google chrome. Some notible features are a social media content curator, Contact us form, and a reCAPTCHA security component.

projects.name: Angel City Sports Event Management App
projects.description: Angel City Sports was a great project to work on. This was a 16 week project with 10 other students from Lambda School. I was tasked with Auth0 authentication implementation, AWS Deployment, and buuilding several different components/pages within the site. The site is 100% responsive and has some Jest unit testing. This was a great project for me because the client wanted a completely different tech stack to be used.
